BinaryTree :¶

class source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeClassifier(max_depth=-1)¶

Torch decision tree object used to solve classification problem. This object implements the fitting and prediction function which can be used with torch tensors. The binary tree is based on source.decision_node.DecisionNode which are built during the fit() and called recursively during the predict().

Parameters

max_depth (int) – The maximum depth which corresponds to the maximum successive number of source.decision_node.DecisionNode.

fit(vectors, labels, criterion=None)¶

Function which must be used after the initialisation to fit the binary tree and build the successive source.decision_node.DecisionNode to solve a specific classification problem.

Parameters

  • vectors (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape [num_vectors, num_dimensions].

  • labels (torch.LongTensor) – Labels tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the labels associated to each vectors and must correspond to the following shape [num_vectors].

  • criterion (function) – Optional function used to optimize the splitting for each source.decision_node.DecisionNode. If none given, the entropy function is used.

predict(vector)¶

Function which must be used after the the fitting of the binary tree. It calls recursively the different source.decision_node.DecisionNode to classify the vector.

Parameters

vector (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor which must be classified. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_dimensions).

Returns

Tensor which corresponds to the label predicted by the binary tree.

Return type

torch.LongTensor

class source.binary_tree.TorchDecisionTreeRegressor(max_depth=-1)¶

Torch decision tree object used to solve regression problem. This object implements the fitting and prediction function which can be used with torch tensors. The binary tree is based on source.decision_node.DecisionNode which are built during the fit() and called recursively during the predict().

Parameters

max_depth (int) – The maximum depth which corresponds to the maximum successive number of source.decision_node.DecisionNode.

fit(vectors, values, criterion=None)¶

Function which must be used after the initialisation to fit the binary tree and build the successive source.decision_node.DecisionNode to solve a specific regression problem.

Parameters

  • vectors (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_vectors, num_dimensions_vectors).

  • values (torch.FloatTensor) – Values tensor used to fit the decision tree. It represents the values associated to each vectors and must correspond to the following shape (num_vectors, num_dimensions_values).

  • criterion (function) – Optional function used to optimize the splitting for each source.decision_node.DecisionNode. If none given, the variance function is used.

predict(vector)¶

Function which must be used after the the fitting of the binary tree. It calls recursively the different source.decision_node.DecisionNode to regress the vector.

Parameters

vector (torch.FloatTensor) – Vectors tensor which must be regressed. It represents the data and must correspond to the following shape (num_dimensions).

Returns

Tensor which corresponds to the value regressed by the binary tree.

Return type

torch.FloatTensor
